meanings.definition: To throw in various random directions.
meanings.sent1: She was scattering seeds in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The wind was scattering the leaves all over the yard.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was scattering nuts everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter scattered like confetti in the air.
meanings.sent5: The children were scattering glitter during the art project.

meanings.sent1: The teacher was scattering knowledge among the students.
meanings.sent2: The clouds were scattering raindrops across the fields.
meanings.sent3: The magician was scattering magic dust at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness scattered warmth throughout the community.
meanings.sent5: The music was scattering joy in the hearts of the listeners.

meanings.definition: A small, dispersed amount of something.
meanings.sent1: There was a scattering of stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: She noticed a scattering of crumbs on the kitchen table.
meanings.sent3: The artist used a scattering of colors in the painting.
meanings.sent4: The scattering of applause filled the concert hall.
meanings.sent5: The scattering of flowers added beauty to the garden.
